TopicTitle: What will you do for your first ksp2 mission

Articles.Content: So, what are you doing for your first mission in ksp2. I’m going to do a metallic hydrogen only mission to the mun
I'm just gonna do a short hop to orbit and back, same as I did once I bought KSP.
I’m going to put a mk 1 pod on an SRB and collect enough science to get the swivel engine.
I'm just gonna be slapping different engines to a tiny rocket and just look at the eye candy plumes, then I will land somewhere on the grass and timewarp to watch the sunset
I am going to build a simple rocket to grasp the controls of KSP computer and try to go to orbit.

Setting up a colony on Duna for the Utopia Planitia Fleet Yards i will build later on.

 

Edit: If you mean first mission as first launch: Putting a MK1 Pod on the launch pad to collect my first science.

Edited January 28, 2022 by Gurkonier

Wh... Why are you people talking like mk1 pod is going to be a starting vehicle for whatever reason, or you're going to collect science points to unlock parts when you know full well that the entire science system is either thrown into the trash or reimagined from scratch?

I have no idea what my first mission is going to be because I don't know what the game will throw at me in the first minute of my progression save.
Depends on what the game looks like, we currently don't know what it looks like.
Something with a Orion drive.

43 minutes ago, The Aziz said:

Wh... Why are you people talking like mk1 pod is going to be a starting vehicle for whatever reason, or you're going to collect science points to unlock parts when you know full well that the entire science system is either thrown into the trash or reimagined from scratch?

I have no idea what my first mission is going to be because I don't know what the game will throw at me in the first minute of my progression save.

I was referencing the first mission in KSP 1 as a way to say that I will be doing the progression in KSP 2. Also, I feel that there is a pretty good chance the initial missions will look similar for nostalgia purposes.
Something I normally never do, and only did back when Kerbin wasn't even a planet yet. Strap as many boosters and rocket engines as my computer can handle and hit LAUNCH!

With how beautiful the game is going to be; I'd like it to be high priority to explore every inch of Kerbin.

Easter eggs, cool landscapes, possibly cities???
I think I'll wait to answer this until I get the game and see the layout of the tech tree and contracts.

6 hours ago, t_v said:

nostalgia purposes.

No point. It is no direct sequel or continuation where you need to know the first before starting the second, only a better, bigger installment of the series. There are people who never touched KSP1 and will start their adventure in KSP2. That nostalgia won't mean anything to them, it will be seen as strange choice, exactly like it is today.

GIRD-09 replica in sandbox mode.

Image source- http://www.russianspaceweb.com/gird09.html

It won't even reach space, but flying it and then leaving the debris is very symbolic to have still visible in your tracking center when you start landing on Duna or visiting the Jool system however long after. It will be even more poetic when going interstellar!
I will probably slap together something resembling a rocket just to get myself used to the controls
Crash!  Big badda boom!
Won't be my first launch of course, but my first major goal will be to get to establishing a colony on Minmus. I'm so excited for stock extraplanetary launchpads!
Launching the most basic rocket... of course with the parachute executing in the same stage as the main engine. It is tradition!
Nice ol' Mun mission!

I will launch several rockets , one to the mun , one to duna with a rover , one to Eve ( this will be my first Eve mission BTW )

I will speed-run to get to gurdamma and beyond

What I’m going to do is explore in sandbox before starting an adventure mode save and just blasting to tiny once useless moons that are now very useful because of the easy launch abilities that they now have
Crash the game by messing up with the game files
ehh, crash a missile into the mun
Why is no-one posting "build an interstellar ship first thing"?
